intro: Feuilleea ciliata, commonly known as the featherleaf ciliate, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its distinctive, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the Asteraceae family. Feuilleea ciliata is adapted to survive in dry conditions, with a deep root system and succulent leaves that store water. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal in drought-tolerant gardens.
